publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-267 Robin Harper: Commercial GM Crops—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce an open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops for commercial purposes until they are shown to be safe with respect to existing agriculture and Scotland’s natural heritage.

S1M-267 Robin Harper: Commercial GM Crops-That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce an open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops for commercial purposes until they are shown to be safe with respect to existing agriculture and Scotland's natural heritage.
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Irene McGugan*

S1M-267 Robin Harper: Commercial GM Crops—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce an open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops for commercial purposes until they are shown to be safe with respect to existing agriculture and Scotland’s natural heritage. Supported by: Irene McGugan
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Michael Russell*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Alasdair Morgan*, Dr Winnie Ewing*
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Colin Campbell*, Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-267 Robin Harper: Commercial GM Crops—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce an open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops for commercial purposes until they are shown to be safe with respect to existing agriculture and Scotland’s natural heritage. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Alasdair Morgan, Dr Winnie Ewing, Colin Campbell, Cathy Jamieson
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Brian Adam*

S1M-267 Robin Harper: Commercial GM Crops—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce an open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops for commercial purposes until they are shown to be safe with respect to existing agriculture and Scotland’s natural heritage. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Alasdair Morgan, Dr Winnie Ewing, Colin Campbell, Cathy Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Brian Adam
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Fiona McLeod*
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Ms Sandra White*

S1M-267 Robin Harper: Commercial GM Crops—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce an open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops for commercial purposes until they are shown to be safe with respect to existing agriculture and Scotland’s natural heritage. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Alasdair Morgan, Dr Winnie Ewing, Colin Campbell, Cathy Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Brian Adam, Fiona McLeod, Ms Sandra White, Kate Maclean*
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Shona Robison*

S1M-267 Robin Harper: Commercial GM Crops—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce an open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops for commercial purposes until they are shown to be safe with respect to existing agriculture and Scotland’s natural heritage. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Alasdair Morgan, Dr Winnie Ewing, Colin Campbell, Cathy Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Brian Adam, Fiona McLeod, Ms Sandra White, Kate Maclean, Shona Robison
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Ms Margo MacDonald*

S1M-267 Robin Harper: Commercial GM Crops—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce an open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops for commercial purposes until they are shown to be safe with respect to existing agriculture and Scotland’s natural heritage. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Alasdair Morgan, Dr Winnie Ewing, Colin Campbell, Cathy Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Brian Adam, Fiona McLeod, Ms Sandra White, Kate Maclean, Shona Robison, Ms Margo MacDonald
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-267 Commercial GM Crops (lodged on 10 November 1999) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S1M-267 Robin Harper: Commercial GM Crops—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce an open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops for commercial purposes until they are shown to be safe with respect to existing agriculture and Scotland’s natural heritage. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Alasdair Morgan, Dr Winnie Ewing, Colin Campbell, Cathy Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Brian Adam, Fiona McLeod, Ms Sandra White, Kate Maclean, Shona Robison, Ms Margo MacDonald, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill
